column3: What is the morphosyntactic type of the entity participating in the formation of a subordinate clause?
column7: Can the entity be used with a noun in free state (EL, état libre)?
column8: Can the entity be used with a noun in annexed state (EA, état d'annexion)?
column9: Can this entity be used to form a complement clause?
column10: What is the semantics/semantic type of the main verb?
column11: How finite is the form of the verb in the complement clause?
column12: What is the coreferentiality status between the subject of the main clause and that of the complement clause?
column13: Can this entity be used to form a relative clause?
column14: How finite is the form of the verb in the relative clause?
column15: What is the antecedent of the relative clause?
column16: Can this entity be used by itself to form an adverbial clause?
column17: What is the first meaning of the self-formed adverbial clause?
column18: What is the first general semantic type of the self-formed adverbial clause?
column19: What is the second meaning of the self-formed adverbial clause?
column20: What is the second general semantic type of the self-formed adverbial clause?
column21: How finite is the form of the verb in the self-formed adverbial clause?
column22: Does this entity by itself cause attraction in the self-formed adverbial clause?
column23: Can this entity be used as a part of some construction to form an adverbial clause?
column24: What is the form of the first construction?
column25: What are the components of the first construction?
column26: What is the meaning of the first-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column27: What is the general semantic type of the first-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column28: How finite is the form of the verb in the first-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column29: Does the first construction cause attraction in the adverbial clause?
column30: What is the form of the second construction?
column31: What are the components of the second construction?
column32: What is the meaning of the second-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column33: What is the general semantic type of the second-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column34: How finite is the form of the verb in the second-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column35: Does the second construction cause attraction in the adverbial clause?
column36: What is the form of the third construction?
column37: What are the components of the third construction?
column38: What is the meaning of the third-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column39: What is the general semantic type of the third-construction-formed adverbial clause?
column40: How finite is the form of the verb in the third-construction-formed adverbial clause?

column31: qb̠el~qeb̠l PREP.BEFORE + a REL + ma INT

column42: As a subordinator, preposition has the form ḥetta

column25: zeg PREP.FROM + ya UNCLEAR (probably y UNCELAR + a REL)

column37: deg PREP.IN + was UNCLEAR + mi INT
seg PREP.FROM + was UNCLEAR + mi INT

column25: n UNCLEAR + səgg PREP.FROM + i UNCLEAR
kəlb PREP.BEFORE + aw PTCL.LEST + d UNCLEAR
bla PREP.WITHOUT + aw PTCL.LEST + d UNCLEAR

column42: Data taken for Ayt Hmed variety

column25: bla PREP.WITHOUT + ma INT (+ a(d) PTCL.IRR)
column42: Data taken for Ayt Hmed variety. There is clitic fronting (attraction), but it is caused not by the preposition, but by the aorist verb form, obligatorily following the irrealis particle a(d).

column25: qbel PREP.BEFORE + ma INT (+ a(d) PTCL.IRR)
column42: Data taken for Ayt Hmed variety. There is clitic fronting (attraction), but it is caused not by the preposition, but by the aorist verb form, obligatorily following the irrealis particle a(d) in the first constrction, and by the negator n in the second construction.
Data taken for Ayt Hmed variety.  As a preposition, ḥetta is always used in a complex with za 'to'.
Arabic < min sabab ‘from the cause of’
The marker is treated in the section on adverbial clauses as a conjunction, although it is mentioned in the section on prepositions.
The marker is treated in the section on adverbial clauses as a conjunction, although it is mentioned in the section on prepositions.

column25: fæ̀l PREP.ON + à DEM + s PREP.WITH

column42: As a preposition, zzat is always used in a complex with i 'to'.
